Lord Chamberlain Hans Joseph
von Frasch, alias Bill Scott, chairman of the Y Social Committee,
proclaimed the King's Cotillion

informal. Admission, Scott stated,
will be only a dollar, including
all reiri-ishments.
Levering Hall's new redecoration, reported elsewhere in this
issue, will be completed in time for
the dance. In addition, several
special effects in decoration, including torchlight and fountains,
will be installed for the evening.
The decor will be in the manner
of the Austrian Court of Emperor
Franz Joseph, Lord Chamberlain
Scott-Frasch said.

follows the Y to serve elaborate
refreshments free of charge. At
this dance cake, coffee, pineapple
and ice, and King's Punch will be
served.
In addition to the newly repainted Great Hall, the entire
building except the Cafeteria and
the Sherwood Room will be turned
over to the dance.
The Blue Jays, re-organized as
Hans Nix and His Royal German
Rita
Orchestra, will perform.
Aquilano, about whom Scott said,
"sensational in any Empire," will
be the vocalist with the Jays.

or third periods of the game may return to the field until the
next quarter. A player leaving the game in .the second or
fourth quarter before the last four minutes of the period may
not return until the final four minutes of the canto in which he

or third periods of the game may return to the field until the
next quarter. A player leaving the game in .the second or
fourth quarter before the last four minutes of the period may
not return until the final four minutes of the canto in which he
